protobuf.codec
Class AbstractCodec

java.lang.Object
  protobuf.codec.AbstractCodec
All Implemented Interfaces:
Codec
Direct Known Subclasses:
JsonCodec, XmlCodec
public abstract class AbstractCodec
extends Object
implements Codec

Codec base class, provides for common validations and functionality

Author:
sijuv

fromMessage

public void fromMessage(com.google.protobuf.Message message,
                        Writer writer)
                 throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Codec
Write this Message Message to the provided output stream. The underlying stream is not closed by default, user Codec.Feature.CLOSE_STREAM for the required settings. The default values are not written out, the reason being that the client should be aware of the protobuf schema. The UnknownFieldSet are written out on whether the Feature#UNKNOWN_FIELDS is set. By default, UnknownFieldSet is written out Check the codec implementation on how the unknown field set is written out. Extension fields are written out and the naming depends on the Codec.Feature.EXTENSION_FIELD_NAME_PREFIX set. If an extension field not provided in the registry is encountered that field is skipped.

Specified by:
fromMessage in interface Codec
Parameters:
message - the Message
Throws:
IOException

toMessage

public <T extends com.google.protobuf.Message> T toMessage(Class<T> messageType,
                                                           Reader reader,
                                                           com.google.protobuf.ExtensionRegistry extnRegistry)
                                                throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Codec
Create a Message off the provided input stream.The underlying stream is not closed by default, user Codec.Feature.CLOSE_STREAM for the required settings. In case null values encountered are skipped since protobuf does not support null values yet ( http://code.google.com/p/protobuf/issues/detail?id=57 ) Extension fields looked up from the provided extension registry, if a field from the provided stream is identified to be an extension field, but a corresponding mapping is not found in the registry, then the field is skipped.

Specified by:
toMessage in interface Codec
Parameters:
messageType - the Class corresponding to the Message the stream needs to be read into
extnRegistry - the extension registry which contains the defn for extension fields.
Returns:
the Message
Throws:
IOException

toMessage

public <T extends com.google.protobuf.Message> T toMessage(Class<T> messageType,
                                                           Reader reader)
                                                throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Codec
Create a Message off the provided input stream.The underlying stream is not closed by default, user Codec.Feature.CLOSE_STREAM for the required settings. In case null values encountered are skipped since protobuf does not support null values yet ( http://code.google.com/p/protobuf/issues/detail?id=57 ) The default values are not written out, the reason being that the client should be aware of the protobuf schema. The UnknownFieldSet are read in depending on whether the Feature#UNKNOWN_FIELDS is set. By default, UnknownFieldSet is read in. Check the codec implementation on how the unknown field need to be passed in. Extension field names depend on Codec.Feature.EXTENSION_FIELD_NAME_PREFIX If an extension field not provided in the registry is encountered that field is skipped.

Specified by:
toMessage in interface Codec
Parameters:
messageType - the Class corresponding to the Message the stream needs to be read into
Returns:
the Message
Throws:
IOException

isExtensionFieldName

public static boolean isExtensionFieldName(String fieldName,
                                           Map<Codec.Feature,Object> featureMap)
Whether the provied field name follows the naming scheme for extn fields. default pattern is "extension-". Codec.Feature.EXTENSION_FIELD_NAME_PREFIX can dictate the prefix

Parameters:
fieldName - the field name
Returns:
true if the field name follows the naming scheme for extn fields, false otherwise
